name: Cursor
tagline: The AI code editor that builds software for you.
shortDescription: A fork of VS Code with built-in AI that can write entire features.
fullReview:
What is Cursor?

Cursor is not just another plugin; it is a full-fledged fork of VS Code designed from the ground up to pair-program with you. Imagine VS Code, but with an AI that understands your entire codebase, can refactor entire files, and even fix terminal errors with a single click. For students and junior developers, it reduces the barrier to entry significantly.

Key Features

  • Chat with Codebase: Unlike ChatGPT which only knows what you paste, Cursor indexes your workspace. You can ask, "Where is the auth logic defined?" and it will point you to the exact file.
  • Auto-Debug: When your terminal throws an error, a new "Auto-Debug" button appears. Click it, and Cursor analyzes the stack trace and suggests a fix instantly.
  • Copilot++: This feature predicts your next edit, not just the next word. It allows for extremely fast implementation of boilerplate code.

Is the Pro Plan worth it?

Access to the basic features is free, but the Pro plan ($20/mo) unlocks the faster GPT-4 and Claude 3.5 Sonnet models. For professional developers, the time saved in debugging alone justifies the cost. For students, the free tier is generous enough to get started.

The Verdict

Cursor is currently the gold standard for AI coding environments. It feels native, fast, and remarkably intelligent. If you are starting a new project in 2025, you should be using Cursor.

pros: Available in VS Code, JetBrains, etc.
